case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman presents to the dermatology clinic with inflammation of her fingernails that first appeared 5 months ago and recently worsened. She reports wearing acrylic nails for the last year, removing them just before the clinic visit. On examination, the patient has erythema and swelling of the lateral nail folds and hyperpigmentation of the proximal nail folds of all fingers on her right hand. Examination also reveals nail dystrophy, onycholysis, and an absence of cuticles. She has not tried any treatments for this condition.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have redness and swelling around my fingernails, discoloration near the base of the nails, and my nails are misshapen and lifting off the nail bed. Also, my cuticles are gone.
Have you had any recent injuries or infections to your fingers or nails?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or infections to my fingers or nails.
Do you have a history of psoriasis or any other skin conditions?
No, I do not have a history of psoriasis or any other skin conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications or have any other health issues?
No, I am not taking any medications or have any other health issues.
Is there a history of similar nail problems in your family?
No, there is no history of similar nail problems in my family.
Do you frequently immerse your hands in water or use harsh chemicals?
No, I do not frequently immerse my hands in water or use harsh chemicals.
Final Diagnosis: Nail Lichen Planus

I'm experiencing redness and swelling around the sides of my fingernails and darker skin near the base of my nails on my right hand. My nails also look damaged and the skin that usually surrounds the nails is gone.

I've been experiencing these symptoms for about 5 months, and they have recently gotten worse.

Yes, the areas around my fingernails are red and swollen, which is sensitive.

No, I haven't had any trauma or injury; I've just been wearing acrylic nails for the last year.

No, I have not tried any treatments for this condition.
Do you have any history of skin conditions or allergies?
I didn't mention any history of skin conditions or allergies.
Final Diagnosis: Acrylic Nail Damage with possible Onycholysis and Paronychia.
